questions.question_text:
FortiGate is operating in NAT mode and is configured with two virtual LAN (VLAN) subinterfaces added to the same physical interface.
In this scenario, which statement about the VLAN IDs is true?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
FG Infra 7.0 pag 152

Multiple VLANs can coexist in the same physical interface, provided they have
different VLAN IDs. 
Pg 159 Inf study guide

choices.C: The two VLAN subinterfaces can have the same VLAN ID only if they belong to different VDOMs.
choices.A: The two VLAN subinterfaces can have the same VLAN ID only if they have IP addresses in the same subnet.
choices.D: The two VLAN subinterfaces must have different VLAN IDs.
choices.B: The two VLAN subinterfaces can have the same VLAN ID only if they have IP addresses in different subnets.

discussion.content: B. Protocolo 17 significa UDP y proto_state = 1 es bidireccional (proto_state = 0 es unidireccional)

Selected Answer: B
c) UDP (proto 17).
Note: Even though UDP is a stateless protocol, the FortiGate still keeps track of 2 different 'states'

State Value

UDP Reply not seen 0
UDP Reply seen 1
https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Troubleshooting-Tip-FortiGate-session-table-information/ta-p/196988

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer

Selected Answer: B
bidirectional UDP

Selected Answer: B
proto=17 shows it is UDP

Selected Answer: B
https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Troubleshooting-Tip-FortiGate-session-table-information/ta-p/196988

comments.content:
the FortiGate session table does use the
proto_state= field to track the unidirectional UDP as state 0, and the bidirectional UDP as state 1.
 FortiGate_Security_7.0_Study_Guide-Online Page 192

Its A

proto=17 -> UDP
proto_state=01 -> UDP Reply seen
A is wrong

discussion.content: ans is A. Protocol state is 01

choices.D: The session is a bidirectional TCP connection.
choices.A: The session is in TCP ESTABLISHED state.
choices.C: The session is a UDP unidirectional state.
choices.B: The session is a bidirectional UDP connection.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibits.
The exhibits contain a network diagram, central SNAT policy, and IP pool configuration.
Exhibit A.
//IMG//

Exhibit B.
//IMG//

The WAN (port1) interface has the IP address 10.200.1.1/24.
The LAN (port3) interface has the IP address 10.0.1.254/24.
A firewall policy is configured to allow all destinations from LAN (port3) to WAN (port1).
Central NAT is enabled, so NAT settings from matching Central SNAT policies will be applied.
Which IP address will be used to source NAT the traffic, if the user on Local-Client (10.0.1.10) pings the IP address of Remote-FortiGate (10.200.3.1)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It's A because of the protocol number.
A it's the correct answer

Selected Answer: A
Ping = icmp
Answer is D

Selected Answer: D
It selects the interface by best latency. so Port 1 has the besdt latency. Answer is D
answer is D

Selected Answer: D
Best Quality: dinámico según la “calidad” de los caminos disponibles 
Opciones: latencia, Jitter, pérdida de paquetes y ancho de banda disponible (o combinación de ellos) 
Preferencia de interfaces (caminos) configurada inicialmente 
No recomendado por fabricante para shortcuts ADVPN (para evitar potenciales “flapeos” en los shortcuts).

Selected Answer: D
Quality is latency, check preference and Port 1 is the one , answer is D

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibits.
Exhibit A.
//IMG//

Exhibit B.
//IMG//

The exhibit contains the configuration for an SD-WAN Performance SLA, as well as the output of diagnose sys virtual-wan-link health-check.
Which interface will be selected as an outgoing interface?
Which scanning technique on FortiGate can be enabled only on the CLI?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B:

The AI scan is an optional feature that must be enabled in the CLI. You can configure the action for the AI
scan to enable, monitor, or disable using the CLI command in the antivirus settings.
B. Fortigate Study Guide 7.0 pag 471
7.0 Security pg 476
